attributes.action: Support TfL's (Sept 2015) proposals to protect Taxi and PHV passengers.
attributes.background: Taxi & PHV passengers should be protected from unregulated drivers who have not undergone extensive criminal record and medical checks from operating in the imediate hire market. For too long, smartphone apps such as Über have been circumventing the law governing the taxi and minicab industry.

rejection.details:
Transport for London is accountable to the London Assembly.

The London Assembly has its own petitions process. You can find out more about how to petition the London Assembly here:

https://www.london.gov.uk/mayor-assembly/london-assembly/take-part/petitions

If you would like the proposals that TFL has made about taxis in London to apply in the rest of the country, you could start a petition specifically asking for that to happen.
